column4: can someone help me read dvds on my computer? i put them in, and nothing happens
have you installed the ubuntu-restricted-extras package?
sudo apt-get install libdvdnav4 libdvdread4 gstreamer0.10-plugins-bad gstreamer0.10-plugins-ugly
as you can see you can put in multiple package names and apt will hopefully install them all without errors
and it is?
that is why we are here :)
no output from that command?
ok, well let it finish doing what it is doing
ok so now in terminal you should be back at the prompt
alright pop in a dvd and cross your toes :)
what app are you using to view the dvd?
let me check something in vlc, I remember I had to change a setting to get dvd to work for me
open VLC, click on Tools > Preferences then on the left hand side pane click on Video. What is in the Output box?
change it to X11 video output, click save and try the dvd again
so when you put a dvd in the drive it does not load automatically?
thaqt is a whole other issue then and I don't know how to help with that but it is a IMPORTANT piece of info to share with us :)
well rephrase your question and include that the dvd drive is not being recognised
no problem
Well we can hope
but you have all the apps and libs you need now to play dvd.
this is going to sound like a strange question but you are certain that the drive is a DVD drive ?
